value.0: Greetings and well met! I believe you should speak to Sedos first, and finish what tasks she may have for you.

Comment.value: cast a bless spell on PC.  Whenever conversation is broken off start a 6 second timer to spawn in mysterious assailants.

value.0: Welcome to you. I regret I did not get a chance to introduce myself properly to you while you were training at the Academy.
I am Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande, paladin in the service of Tyr, and the right-hand of Nasher Alagondar, Lord of Neverwinter. I have been waiting for you!
I knew I could count on you. I hope you will bring us the same success as you have had in restoring order in the districts.
As you may know, the Wailing Death is not an ordinary disease, but a magical one. Our most divine clerics and priests can only do so much to slow it's progress in those afflicted.
Finding a cure for the Wailing Death is our top priority. This is the task that I will set upon you, recruit. As you may already know, there are many rumours that Blacklake has a cure for the plague.
However, we have not been able to make our way into the district. Amongst the current chaos, an elven wizard named Meldanen rose in power and took control of the district.
He has barricaded the district and hired many soldiers and sellswords to protect it. If things were to get bloody, the city will again plunge into chaos and possibly civil war.
Not only that, but our spies were easily caught through his magical scrying - nothing escapes his watchful eye. We will only be able to enter with his permission.
Despite it all, there's been an interesting development. This may come as a surprise, but he wants to speak with you. It would seem that he has taken notice of your deeds.
Meldanen wants to hire you as a mercenary. Beyond that, his motives are unknown. It is certainly an opportunity we cannot miss.
Then it is settled. Talk to the gate guard outside Blacklake, then meet with Meldanen. Get close with him, and return to me with information about a cure. I wish you luck, <FirstName>.
Is there something else you need, <FirstName>?
I will do my best to answer what questions I may, <FirstName>.
Farewell, <FirstName>. May Tyr guide your steps.
It is no secret that Fenthick and I are lovers. Our feelings for each other are only matched by our devotion to Tyr and our loyalty to Neverwinter.
Although Lord Nasher has placed me in charge of finding a cure for the plague, I could not do this without Fenthick's help. His faith and conviction are a comfort to me in times of darkness.
The first victims were reported several months ago, and within days it had spread to all corners of the city. It was not the first plague Neverwinter has suffered, but it is by far the worst.
Unlike other sicknesses, the Wailing Death seems to resist all efforts to cure it, including the divine magic of the priests. Perhaps that is what makes it so terrible.

We have quarantined the city, particularly the Beggar's Nest, but that is mostly to help maintain order. It has done little to halt the spread of the disease - though some districts remain largely unaffected.
The plague does not seem to spread through contact with the infected. Healers tend to the sick without becoming ill, and some who lock themselves alone indoors still become infected.
I am not one to boast of my accomplishments, <FirstName>. Suffice to say that I am a Paladin of Tyr and I am honored Lord Nasher has placed me in charge of finding a cure for the Wailing Death.
That's a serious accusation. Could he really be trusted if he lied about not knowing the cure for the Wailing Death? I think we should investigate this lead anyways.
There is one thing you should know - we did allow one group of people into Neverwinter recently, namely the Helmites. They offered immediate aid and we were desperate.
They are stationed in their own temple in Beggar's Nest, which also happens to be most heavily afflicted. It's not entirely implausible.
I would like you enter the temple and investigate. Perhaps there is truth to Meldanen's words. Here is some gold for your efforts. If it is true, then perhaps a cure may be there as well!
Good luck, <FirstName>, and report back to me soon. Tyr guide your path.
I see. This is most troubling. At least now, we can stop the spread of the Wailing Death. And by fortunate coincidence with the sample you have obtained, we can discover a cure!
Is it sheer luck that the esteemed Khelben "Blackstaff" Arunsun had recently sent us an arcane scroll to divine the reagents needed while you were on your mission?
Now, I will use the scroll that he has generously given to us so we may find out what shall be our next steps.
Ah, I see. It would seem that we need to obtain the essence of four magical creatures in order to fabricate a cure for the Wailing Death.
The first one shown was a cockatrice - a dangerous creature that can petrify it's enemies. We need only it's feathers.

I will try to arrange for the delivery of a cockatrice to Neverwinter. Hopefully your efforts to uncover the truth behind the Wailing Death will make the task of arranging that easier, though I fear it will still prove difficult.
Next is the heart of a pure-blood yuan-ti. The yuan-ti are a hybrid between a human and a snake, and also very powerful.
There have been sightings of yuan-tis as well as lizardfolk gathering in the Mere of Dead Men, south of Neverwinter. That will be your best chance at finding a pure-blood.
Third is the brain of an intellect devourer - a vile creature that lives to not only devour the minds of others, but also control them.
I do not know an exact location of where to find one. However, I am sure such a creature would live somewhere in the Underdark.
Lastly, the final creature shown was a dryad. They are beautiful, yet elusive creatures that reside in their forests. All we need from one is a lock of their own hair.
I know of one place where we may find such a creature - Neverwinter Woods to the east, which is home to many fey creatures and their ilk.
Indeed. The fate of Neverwinter rests squarely on your shoulders. I will instruct the gate captains to allow you leave and return to Neverwinter as you please.
Know you have done much for us thus far. Please, take this gold as compensation for your current efforts. I only wish that I can give you more. May Tyr always guide your path!
Nothing yet, <FirstName>. I will let you know once it arrives at Neverwinter.
Certainly. Which one do you want to hear about?
Dryads are beautiful, elusive forest sprites whose charms transcend mere physical appearance. You will likely find one in Neverwinter Woods, east of Neverwinter.
The intellect devourer is a truly horrible entity, resembling a large fleshy brain with legs. It can dominate the minds of its victims so that it may devour their very thoughts.
I know for a fact that they reside in the Underdark, but I do not know a way to get there unfortunately.
The yuan-ti are a race of beings whose bloodlines are a mixture of human and snake. They can be any combination of snake and human characteristics.
They are highly intelligent and many of the creatures practice magic. It is rumored that some even have the ability to alter their shape.
There have been numerous sightings of both yuan-tis and lizardfolk in the Mere of Dead Men, located south of Neverwinter. I would start my search there.
A cockatrice resembles a hybrid of chicken, lizard, and bat. They are repulsive animals that can petrify opponents. You must be extremely cautious when dealing with this beast.
We need it's feathers for the cure. I don't know the exact location of where you can find one, so you will have to find it on your own. I'm sorry I can't help further.
Amazing! And... this heart is so black and vile, nearly as much as the Wailing Death itself. This specimen is more than suitable, <FirstName>.
Please, take this gold! You have more than earned it. Now we are one step closer to a cure and saving Neverwinter and its people! I cannot thank you enough.
Is that so? How did you manage to acquire it? The fey, especially the dryads, are particularly fickle creatures.

I see! I must commend you for going through so much to acquire this reagent. And now you are to be justly rewarded. Here, take this gold, as you have more than earned it. We are now one step closer to finding the cure and saving Neverwinter!

Unfortunately, I have bad news on the cockatrice. Somehow, in the chaos of the plague, it has managed to escape on its way north from Waterdeep. As you may have discovered, the guards have closed the southern roads from Neverwinter. There have been reports of petrified creatures not far off the High Road, and it seems plausible that this could be the work of our cockatrice.
I would like you to investigate and recapture the cockatrice, if possible. Here is a salve that you might find useful against its petrifying bite.
Please also take this letter, it should allow the guards to let you through to the southern roads.
Impressive! I am glad my fears of sending you out to track down such a dangerous beast were unfounded, <FirstName>. This specimen is more than suitable.
Please, take this gold and belt as a reward. I hope that you find it useful. Now we are one step closer to a cure and saving Neverwinter and its people! I cannot thank you enough.
Unfortunately, I have terrible news! While that would be the last reagent, the others have been stolen!
Amazing! I have no idea how you found your way down to the Underdark to get that.
Here, take this gold and these magical boots. Now we are closer to saving Neverwinter and its people!
Incredible! Thank you for all you have done for our city, <FirstName>. Lord Nasher has asked to see you personally.

But before you go, please take this gold. I'd also like you to have this ring for all you have done for us, <FirstName>. Nasher would also like to personally thank you. He can be found in his chamber upstairs.

As it happens, yes. I've recently recieved reports that undead activity has been increasing around Helm's Hold. With the death of Desther, we are not sure why this might be, but in the interests of the city's security I would like you to look into it.

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I'm sorry to say this after all you've done for us, <FirstName>, but I have yet to hear reports to that effect. Word reaches my ear very quickly, and I hope it is not too unreasonable to ask you to wait a moment for that to arrive, if you are being truthful. I hope you understand that with our resources stretched as thin as they are, I cannot afford to reward you until I have heard the news from another source.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You have? That is most fortuitous. Here, take this gold as a reward.
Thank you, <FirstName>. Was there something else you needed?
Excellent work, <FirstName>! Please take this gold as a reward.
<FirstName>! I have terrible news! The cure reagents have been stolen!
We believe that this is the work of Desther, an advisor of Lord Nasher who seems to have had ties with the temple of Helm. We think he has headed to Helm's Hold in the southeast.
For all you have done for our city, please take this gold and cloak. May it protect you on your travels.
After you have already done so much, I am reluctant to ask more of you; but please, <FirstName>, go to Helm's Hold and retrieve the reagents to save our city!
Just tell me what I need to do.
I am at your service, my Lady.
What does he want with me?
Fine. Maybe I'll get paid what I'm worth for once.
If this is to save Neverwinter, I'll do it.
I'll be on my way, then.
Farewell.
I need to ask you some questions.
Goodbye.
Actually, that's enough questions for me.
Tell me about Fenthick.
I want to know more about the Wailing Death.
Did the quarantine do anything to help?
It would be nice to know a little more about the Lady I'm working for.
I've met with Meldanen but he did not know an actual cure. He did tell me that it was a priest of Helm spreading the plague.
I will be on my way, then.
I have investigated the Temple of Helm. <StartAction>[Explain what transpired.]</Start>
What are the magical creatures that I need to find?
I guess I have my work cut out for me.
Does this mean that I can travel outside of Neverwinter?
I will be off, then.
Do you have any news on the cockatrice?
Can you tell me about the creatures again?
That's enough questions about the creatures we need.
Tell me about the dryad.
Tell me about the intellect devourer.
Tell me about the yuan-ti.
Tell me about the cockatrice.
I have the heart of a pure-blood yuan-ti.
I have a lock of hair from a dryad.
<StartAction>[Explain the ordeal about the Spirit of the Neverwinter Woods.]</Start>
Thank you, and farewell.
I have the feathers of a cockatrice.
I have the brain of an intellect devourer.
I have retrieved the reagents. Desther will trouble you no longer.
Thank you, and farewell.
Do you have any work for me?
<StartCheck>[Bluff]</Start> I have just returned from clearing out those undead.
Consider it done.
I have dealt with the source of the undead in Helm's Hold - a lich had taken up residence in an ancient tomb below the fortress.
